author: ricmoo
content: It seems the JSON-RPC is returning 0 as the type for legacy transactions. So I think it may be safe to assume that it is reserved for I typed transactions?

author: sky.cactus
content: Someone should create and maintain a document (not an EIP) that tracks the reserved types.

author: timbeiko
content:
Ok so this conversation is spanning a few channels üòÖ 

<@!358385024573243393> I think your page here is a good idea: https://github.com/ricmoo/eth1.0-specs/tree/master/lists/transaction-types 

It's worth noting that we also created https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-apis to eventually move the JSON RPC out of the consensus specs, but IMO your document should stay where it is given it is part of consensus. <@!543900561460822016> does that make sense to you too? 

As for feedback on it, I've spotted a few typos, but aside from that my only quip is with 0x3: Given that EIP-3074 is not accepted into a HF, I think we should find a separate term/label for it. I'd be fine with "Tentatively Reserved". Thoughts? 

If that SGTY, I think it would make sense to open a PR against the eth1.0-specs repo and add it to the ACD agenda for this Friday so folks are aware of it and have the chance to chime in.

author: timbeiko
content: cc: <@!301186049323958275> so you can follow the thread üôÇ

author: lightclient
content: Yep agree that eth1.0-specs is the right place for the list. In terms of you concerns with the return value of the RPC, the RPC spec would be were to raise those. IMO, we can drop references to EIP-3074 in the tx list until it is scheduled for a hard fork. If something else comes along and takes `0x03`, not hard at all to switch to `0x04`... OTOH, `0x03` and `3074` are kinda nice - so maybe tentatively reserved is in our best interest üôÇ

author: lightclient
content: i don't see a pr into the specs repo yet, but so far i think my feedback would be to consider changing the naming from "transaction types" to something like "signature prefixes" since things like 191 and 3074 are not txs

author: ricmoo
content: I was thinking they are transaction types with just an explanation of why some of the types are ‚Äúreserved‚Äù, which is why it jumps into prefixes.

author: timbeiko
content: Yeah, IMO it's easier to just have "tentative" and worst case if, say, 3074 reserved 0x3, didn't make it into a fork, and some other EIP used 0x4 and made it in, we can always use 0x3 in the next fork
